Texts.Eng: I assume that she misunderstood the implication of my remark, but I cannot help stare a little too long into her triumvirate of ruby red eyes.
"...I guess the standard of art is different in your time, huh?" she says flatly. I presume that the picture was not, in fact, a joke.
"...That's a weird name," she says flatly. "Why would your parents even call you that?"
"A fun song? That sounds... Fine. What kind of characters would it have?"
"A romantic song! How wonderful! What should it be about?"
"A sad bear? Um, okay. Why is the bear sad?"
"A talking fish sounds fun. What should the fish be doing?"
"Air Hockey? What is this 'Air Hockey'? you speak of?"
"But perhaps..." she says whilst looking intently at the staff in her hand, "Perhaps finishing the ceremony will help send you back?"
"Can you tell what it is?" she asks, eagerly.
"Does this 'Air Hockey' of yours usually send people through time?"
"He's losing his house? How sad! I have a song idea, but it isn't very funny." she says.
"How adorable! I think I can sing about this." she says.
"How wholesome! I think I can sing about this." she says.
"I am Kasumi, a shrine maiden sent to bless the Grand Hylotl Library before its opening next week." She explains.
"I can picture it now! Why is he so lovesick?"
"I don't know!" she cries out. I feel something tugging at me. An unseen hand of fate. I suddenly realise my time here may be over shortly.
"I have finished!" she announces. Her smile glitters in the sunset like the lure of a beautiful angler fish.
"If you have been sent through time and space at an unusual rate, what do you think caused you to come here?"
"It's a pleasure to meet you, Vaughn St. Lovecastle!" she says with a pleasant smile. "Why are you interested in this unopened library, of all places?"
"Lone Octopus, hesong fatigued, because his crush, is out of his league."
"Lone Octopus, you can't just wait, put in some effort, if you want to date."
"No-one else is supposed to be here whilst I bless the island! Why did you come here?"
"No-one else is supposed to be here, though! Why did you come here?"
"Okay, I think I have something..." she says.
"Perhaps it was something else?" she says thoughtfully..
"Poor lonely octopus! I have a song in mind just for this." she says.
"Sad old bear, destined to roam, after the banks, repossessed his home."
"Sad old bear, it's all gone wrong, since you realised, you're just a song."
"So tell me," she begins, " Why are you interested in this unopened library, of all places?"
"Starfish lovers, oh so sweet, how do you dance, without some feet?"
"Starfish lovers, united hearts, met at the youth club, playing darts."
"Talking fish, of utmost health, what makes you journey, for such wealth?"
"Talking fish, straight from my dreams, how can we, prevent your screams?"
"That is quite tragic! I have a song in mind just for this." she says.
"That sounds good! What kind of song should it be, then?"
"That's a bit weird, we don't know either other that well!" she responds. I barely have time to process my rejection as I feel the familiar tug of time, and everything fades.
"That's cute! Where did they meet?"
"That's right!" she says. "Wait here, and when I'm done, you can judge if my art is worthy."
"The ceremony!" she exclaims. "But it is a ceremony of tradition, not divine power. And it is not even finished, either."
"Travelled... Through time?" she repeats, confused. "But doesn't everyone travel through time?"
"We're all moving through time, at a rate of around 1 second per second." she elaborates.
"Well first was the 'tribute of prayer' - next comes the 'tribute of talent', and then the 'tribute of song'."
"Well of course it isn't - I was interrupted by you flailing about and screaming for help."
"Well of course it isn't - I was interrupted by you flailing about screaming for help."
"Where are my manners," she adds suddenly, "I forgot to ask you your name. Who are you?"
"Where are my manners," she adds suddenly, "My name is Kasumi. And who might you be?"
"Who are you, and why are you screaming like a nerd?" says the girl, light dancing off her beautiful, clammy skin.
"Who are you, and why are you sneaking around?" says the girl, light dancing off her beautiful, clammy skin.
"Why, thank you!" she says with a beaming smile.
"Yelling? Sure. In fact, I think I have something..." she says.
"Yep! Here it is!"
"You'll be able to see when I show you, riiiight now!".
"You're at the Grand Hylotl Library, which is opening one week from tonight." She explains.
"Your story is far-fetched, Mr. Lovecastle," she begins, "But you don't look or talk like anyone I've ever known. Perhaps your story is true."
"Your story sounds insane," she begins, "But you don't look or talk like anyone I've ever known. Perhaps your story is true."
A fun song!
A lovesick octopus!
A romantic song!
A sad bear!
A talking fish!
A youth club!
After what feels like a millenia, but also only maybe five or six minutes, I wake up where I began.
An alien of some kind?
An ethereal light suddenly fills the area as her words of power leave her lips. My stomach churns like a washing machine left out in the sun.
An unfamiliar land, a pounding headache... I decide to approach this situation with stealth. I crouch low, making my way across the beach towards the pagoda.
Beautiful Attempt! Sakura Shrine Maiden Hearts+
But at least I'll have my games.
Can I see?
Continue Studying
Could she truly love me? Will she be able to come to the present with me? Will that cause a rift in the space-time continuum?
Cry for help
Curiously enough, I see a letter, sticking out of the rubble. It looks old, very old. Has this always been here?
Find great love in the distant past
Give her a romantic fake name
He can't get a date!
He doesn't exist!
He loves a Hylotl!
His house is being foreclosed!
However, the thoughts of Air Hockey have gripped me once more. But my studies cannot be ignored...
However, who instead greets me is a beautiful girl, dressed in strange ceremonial robes. Grasped in her hands is a pink staff.
I am not on fire, but that doesn't give me much reassurance. The place I am in is almost entirely unfamiliar.
I am on the shore of a small island, in the center of which is a grand pagoda. A sun sets above me. It is clear to me that I must plan my next move very carefully...
I ask her what she means.
I ask her why her ceremony wasn't complete.
I cannot tell if this beautiful girl is a genius or insane.
I collapse to the ground sobbing, next to the destroyed table. It was too real - Kasumi can't just be a dream, can she?
I could never destroy this Hockey table. Beautiful shrine maidens may come and go...
I cry out in a dramatic and wimpering rage. This Hockey table is nothing compared to love. In my anger, I attempt to flip the table, but my weak arms fail me.
I cry out in a dramatic and wimpering rage. This Hockey table is nothing compared to love. In my anger, I flip the table over, sending it crashing to the ground.
I figure that I may have upset her, and desperately think of a way to move the conversation forward.
I find myself at the campus arcade, my three eyes staring at the beauty I see before me. We meet again, friend.
I have a short time go gather my thoughts.
I have precious seconds left. I may fail at winning her love, but I must make an attempt! A BEAUTIFUL ATTEMPT!
I hear voices! I hide behind a nearby post. The architecture is all Hylotl, so at least my chances of being in Floran territory seems low.
I leave my dormitory quietly, remaining careful not to let my excitement overwhelm me and cause me to involuntarily yell out 'air hockey!', like the last time I snuck out.
I lift out the letter. Everything comes down to this.
I love you!
I never hear her reply, as time pulls me away into the dark void of nothingness once more.
I open the envelope, my heart racing. Perhaps the letter from Kasumi will instruct me how to return to her time so we can resume our fated love?
I panic and start yelling. I'm sure I will draw the attention of a helpful authority figure who will help me in my predicament.
I place the puck on the table, savouring the moment. My heart skips a beat... But something feels wrong.
I ponder my tribulations so far, but as I do so, Kasumi returns with a rolled up scroll.
I question if Kasumi has literally ever seen a duck, or even heard a second-hand description of one.
I quickly explain to Kasumi that in my era, the library is open.
I suddenly feel the crushing weight of how serious my circumstances have become.
I tend to my studies again, but soon the slippery tendrils of desire grasp my subconscious, and I am drawn to the table as if possessed by a spirit of raw aspiration.
I tersely avoid the subject of my name's embarassing origin.
I turn back to her. "Well?" she asks. "What do you think?"
I was sent through time!
I'm pretty sure no
Is that it?
It's beautiful!
Just yelling at everyone!
Kasumi leaves for the beach, opening a chest of calligraphy brushes. I sit awkwardly on the steps of the pagoda entrance, watching her from a short distance.
Kasumi's poem echoes in my head, guiding me through the darkness. I feel like a fish on a lead. In the dark.
Knowledge is important, I reason, but skill at a lesser known low-friction competitive game is something that will stay with me forever.
Life sure is quiet for me, an unassuming hard-working Hylotl teenage boy at boarding school. Like a discarded plastic bag floating down river, I sometimes feel as if I simply drift through life.
My heart races and I feel the world spinning. I reach out but my hands find no solace. I feel like a beached whale, except the beach I'm on is travelling... Travelling through time!
My only solace is my incredible and unwavering finesse at Air Hockey. Sure, it isn't exactly the most popular game in the universe, but that lets me carve out a niche skill.
My vision slowly returns to me, and I feel warm sand beneath my hands and feet. Am I on a planet's surface? Is that the sun I feel upon me, or perhaps I am merely on fire?
Never forget me!
No it's Air Hockey
Not really, no
Of course I've heard of it, it is a famous historical site, yet right now it hasn't even opened yet! THAT is why I knew I have been sent to the past!
Open the letter
Outside the entrance to the pagoda, I see a girl, kneeling in the sand. I gasp, unable to steel myself, and she turns to see me!
Paint?
Practice Air Hockey
Presently I am in my school dormitory, studying. I am slowly working my way through a textbook titled 'The Art of Hylotl Passive-Aggressiveness'.
Searching for gold!
She doesn't know what Air Hockey is.
She giggles. "No, silly, it's a duck!"
She ignores me entirely, contemplating for a moment before her face lights up.
She is taken aback by the abruptness of my statement. I panic, wondering why that would be one of the first things I would say to a girl.
She nods. "I have to come up with a song that will cleanse the land of uncivility. But I will need help coming up with ideas..."
She presents the scroll to me.
She replies, "Well I'm afraid you've come to the wrong place, because the Grand Hylotl Library isn't open to the public just yet."
She smiles, saying, "I am an artist. I must paint for the ritual!"
She thinks my name is Vaughn St. Lovecastle. If we are truly destined for one another, would she appreciate my true name? Could she ever?
Sneak around
So is the 'Tribute of song' next?
Some sort of dog?
Starfish, in love!
Still on my knees, I eagerly peel away at the wax seal, careful not to tear the paper. Will this be a letter from Kasumi, confessing her love?
Tell her your name
The Hockey table... A beautiful smooth surface, perforated and varnished. It is the stone tablet upon which I enscribe my will, and the hockey paddle but a chisel of beautiful showmanship!
The Power of Air Hockey
The air is quiet, except for the soft lapping of waves on this mysterious beach. The ocean appears to be water, and not acid or magma. This fact calms me somewhat.
The hockey table... The present day... Kasumi! I feel like fate has been snatched from me.
The library... The Grand Hylotl Library!
The sensation I feel is difficult to describe - like slowly waking from a dream, except the dream involves everyone who has ever lived loudly yelling at you.
The village dance!
There probably isn't even any Air Hockey IN this era.
To meet beautiful girls!
To think that not only is she beautiful, but that she is also a talented artist? Surely I must be in a dream, or perhaps an elaborate coma fantasy.
What did you paint?
What do you need to do?
What is it?
What is the talent?
What's going on?!
Where am I?
Your ceremonial ritual

[This story was written by a diverse team of talented Hylotl Scholars. The creative team are not responsible for any heartbreak or infatuation with fictional characters that may develop from playing this game.]
